meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a mystical or supernatural quality, but not fully mystical.
meanings.sent1: The old book had a semimystical cover that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with semimystical creatures that only appeared at night.
meanings.sent3: The semimystical potion turned out to be just colored water.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a semimystical gaze that seemed to see beyond this world.
meanings.sent5: The semimystical aura surrounding the ancient ruins gave them an otherworldly feel.

meanings.definition: Having elements of mystery or spirituality, but not fully mystical.
meanings.sent1: The semimystical symbols on the wall intrigued the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The semimystical music played softly in the background, creating a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The semimystical fortune teller predicted rainbows and unicorns in his future.
meanings.sent4: Her semimystical smile seemed to hide a secret only she knew.
meanings.sent5: The semimystical mist enveloped the valley, adding an ethereal touch to the landscape.
